Moo::FogHelper

Detailed Description

This collection of methods helps with fog setting.

The methods automatically masks out settings that are not supported by the underlying hardware, substituting vertex fog for table fog when table fog is not supported.

Function Documentation

void Moo::FogHelper::setFog ( float  start,
float  end,
D3DRENDERSTATETYPE  fogState,
D3DFOGMODE  mode 
)

This helper function sets up the fog distance and fog mode.

Parameters:
start the start distance of the fog
end the end distance of the fog
fogState either D3DRS_FOGTABLEMODE or D3DRS_FOGVERTEXMODE
mode the fogging mode to use i.e. D3DFOG_LINEAR, D3DFOG_EXP

void Moo::FogHelper::setFogEnable ( bool  state  ) 

This helper function sets the Fogs enable state.

Parameters:
state true to enable fog false to disable

void Moo::FogHelper::setFogColour ( uint32  colour  ) 

This helper function sets the Fogs colour.

Parameters:
colour The colour to set the Fog to.

void Moo::FogHelper::setFogStart ( float  start  ) 

This helper function sets the Fog start state.

Parameters:
start The start distance for fog.

void Moo::FogHelper::setFogEnd ( float  end  ) 

This helper function sets the Fog end state.

Parameters:
end The end distance for fog.

void Moo::FogHelper::setFogVertexMode ( D3DFOGMODE  mode  ) 

This helper function sets the fog vertex mode, it also disables the fog table mode.

Parameters:
mode The fog vertex mode

void Moo::FogHelper::setFogTableMode ( D3DFOGMODE  mode  ) 

This helper function sets the fog table mode, it also disables the fog vertex mode.

Parameters:
mode The fog table mode

bool Moo::FogHelper::tableModeSupported (  ) 

This helper function checks whether fog table mode is supported.

Returns:
true if table mode is supported.
